text.0: i will declare while juices flow the manly deeds that ye have done.
text.1: your fathers enemies of gods were smitten down and indraagni ye survive.
text.2: thus indraagnip verily your greatness merits loftiest praise.
text.3: sprung from one common father brothers twins are ye your mother is in every place.
text.4: these who delight in flowing juice like fellow horses at their food.
text.5: indra and agni gods armed with the thunderbolt we call this day to come with help.
text.6: indra and agni friends of law served with rich gifts your speech is kind.
text.7: to him who praises you while these libations flow that man o gods ye neer consume.
text.8: what mortal understands o gods indra and agni this your way.
text.9: one of you yoking steeds that move to every side advances in your common car.
text.10: first indraagni hath this maid come footless unto those with feet.
text.11: stretching her head and speaking loudly with her tongue she hath gone downward thirty steps.
text.12: een now o indraagni men hold in their arms and stretch their bows.
text.13: desert us not in this great fray in battles for the sake of kine.
text.14: the foemans sinful enmities indra and agni vex me sore.
text.15: drive those who hate me far away and keep them distant from the sun.
text.16: indra and agni yours are all the treasures of the heavens and earth.
text.17: here give ye us the opulence that prospers every living man.
text.18: o indraagni who accept the laud and hear us for our praise.
text.19: come near us drawn by all our songs to drink of this our soma juice.
